Right now, it doesn't seem like it's blocking my path to (2,5), but I should keep an eye on it. If it moves towards that area, I might have to rethink my plan.

I also need to make sure that I don't run into myself or the walls. Since my snake's body is just at (2,2) right now, moving up won't cause me to hit myself. As I grow when I eat an apple, I have to be careful about that in future moves, but for now, it's not an issue.

Another thought: maybe I should check if any other apples are easier to reach without moving through potential danger zones. Let me see. The apple at (2,5) is straightforward—just up the same x-coordinate. The other apples are further away or in different directions. Going for (2,5) seems the safest and most efficient.

So, I think the best move is to go UP. That way, I can reach the apple at (2,5) without any complications. After that, I can reassess the board for the next move, maybe head towards another apple or respond to where the enemy snake moves.
</think>
